html: Another success story? In 1988, 350,000 children were paralyzed by polio. Because #VaccinesWork, last year we saw just 33 cases. Let’s eradicate polio once and for all by supporting lifesaving vaccine programs this #WorldImmunizationWeek.
text:
Another success story? In 1988, 350,000 children were paralyzed by polio. 

Because #VaccinesWork, last year we saw just 33 cases.  

Let’s eradicate polio once and for all by supporting lifesaving vaccine programs this #WorldImmunizationWeek.

html: The measles vaccine has saved over 21 million lives globally since 2000. This #WorldImmunizationWeek we must protect progress in global public health and ensure that children everywhere have access to lifesaving immunizations. #VaccinesWork @ShotAtLife
text: The measles vaccine has saved over 21 million lives globally since 2000. This #WorldImmunizationWeek we must protect progress in global public health and ensure that children everywhere have access to lifesaving immunizations. #VaccinesWork @ShotAtLife

html: What happens if we #RaiseTheWage? Workers: -Can take care of themselves and their families -Have more money to spend in their communities Raising the minimum wage from $7.25 to $15 is a direct investment in the lives of workers & local economies across the US.pic.twitter.com/5wm652T0DD
text:
What happens if we #RaiseTheWage? Workers:

-Can take care of themselves and their families
-Have more money to spend in their communities

Raising the minimum wage from $7.25 to $15 is a direct investment in the lives of workers & local economies across the US.pic.twitter.com/5wm652T0DD

html: "Many people under the age of 18 right now may be around to see the end of the century [...] Our current trajectory puts the planet on course to warm by 4 degrees Celsius by 2100, creating a world that will be devastated by disasters, droughts, disease, and food shortages."

html: GONE: Support for rural hospitals. As Americans lose coverage, already struggling hospitals will be hit even harder. GONE: Ban on insurance companies having lifetime caps on coverage. GONE: Requirements that insurance companies cover prescription drugs and maternity care.
text:
GONE: Support for rural hospitals. As Americans lose coverage, already struggling hospitals will be hit even harder.

GONE: Ban on insurance companies having lifetime caps on coverage.

GONE: Requirements that insurance companies cover prescription drugs and maternity care.

html: GONE: 2.3 million individuals will no longer be able to stay on their parents’ insurance. GONE: Insurance companies will be able to charge women 50 percent more than men. GONE: Financial assistance that helps 9 million people purchase health care in the marketplace.
text:
GONE: 2.3 million individuals will no longer be able to stay on their parents’ insurance.

GONE: Insurance companies will be able to charge women 50 percent more than men.

GONE: Financial assistance that helps 9 million people purchase health care in the marketplace.

html: GONE: Protections for 130 million Americans with pre-existing conditions. GONE: Medicaid expansion, which covers 17 million people. GONE: Nearly 12 million seniors will have to pay more for prescription drugs

html: By gradually raising the minimum wage from $7.25 to $15 by 2024, we are working toward an America where everyone can succeed, not just the wealthy few. No one who works full-time, year-round should live in poverty. It’s time to #RaiseTheWage.pic.twitter.com/GuIDZfuaRL
text:
By gradually raising the minimum wage from $7.25 to $15 by 2024, we are working toward an America where everyone can succeed, not just the wealthy few. No one who works full-time, year-round should live in poverty.

html: The standard federal minimum wage has been stuck at $7.25 an hour for ten years. That is leaving hardworking families behind. I am proud to be working with my colleagues to #RaiseTheWage to $15 an hour. It is good for workers and good for the economy.

html: I fulfilled my constitutional duty this week when the House voted to protect the Constitution’s separation of powers & end the #FakeEmergency. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to do the same.
text: I fulfilled my constitutional duty this week when the House voted to protect the Constitution’s separation of powers & end the #FakeEmergency. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to do the same.

html: Today I spoke on the floor about Jody Marchand from my district. Jody endured years of domestic abuse. In 2010 she survived a brutal attack by her husband, but lost her beautiful 17-year-old daughter, Olivia, when her husband shot and killed her, and then himself.
text: Today I spoke on the floor about Jody Marchand from my district. Jody endured years of domestic abuse. In 2010 she survived a brutal  attack by her husband, but lost her beautiful 17-year-old daughter, Olivia, when her husband shot and killed her, and then himself.

html: Just left the House floor. Background checks passes by a huge bipartisan margin. 240-190. Unreal. Elections matter. Activism matters. And faith in the righteousness of your cause, no matter the power of the status quo, MATTERS.
text:
Just left the House floor. Background checks passes by a huge bipartisan margin. 240-190. Unreal.

Elections matter. Activism matters. And faith in the righteousness of your cause, no matter the power of the status quo, MATTERS.

html: Today has been a whirlwind, but do not forget that something extraordinary happened. The House of Representatives passed sweeping universal background check legislation. I was proud to support #HR8, and even more proud to have over 90% of Americans on our side. #EndGunViolence

html: In fact, #EqualPayForEqualWork could slash the poverty rate for all working women in half (from 8.1 percent to 3.9 percent) and the poverty rate for working single mothers would be cut by nearly half (from 28.7 percent to 15.0 percent).
text: In fact, #EqualPayForEqualWork could slash the poverty rate for all working women in half (from 8.1 percent to 3.9 percent) and the poverty rate for working single mothers would be cut by nearly half (from 28.7 percent to 15.0 percent).

html: The gender pay gap doesn't just affect women – it affects children and families and our economy as a whole. Did you know that women are the sole or co-breadwinner in half of US families with children? Providing equal pay to women would have a dramatic impact on their families.
text:
The gender pay gap doesn't just affect women – it affects children and families and our economy as a whole.

Did you know that women are the sole or co-breadwinner in half of US families with children? Providing equal pay to women would have a dramatic impact on their families.

html: Today, a woman still makes only 80 cents, on average, for every dollar earned by her white male counterpart. That gap is even worse for women of color. I'm proud to have voted with @HouseDemocrats on the Education and Labor Committee to do something about it. #HR7 #EqualPayhttps://twitter.com/EdLaborCmte/status/1100473638355156992 …
text:

html: NEW: Just moments ago, the @EdLaborCmte approved the #PaycheckFairness Act (H.R. 7). Women deserve equal pay for equal work. I am proud to have supported this bill, and look forward to voting for it on the House Floor.

NEW: Just moments ago, the @EdLaborCmte approved the #PaycheckFairness Act (H.R. 7).

Women deserve equal pay for equal work. I am proud to have supported this bill, and look forward to voting for it on the House Floor.

html: One of the main reasons I ran for office was to make life better for women and hardworking families just like the one I grew up in. Ushering in a new, national paid family leave policy for the United States is one of the most significant steps Congress can take to do just that.
text: One of the main reasons I ran for office was to make life better for women and hardworking families just like the one I grew up in. Ushering in a new, national paid family leave policy for the United States is one of the most significant steps Congress can take to do just that.

html: Family #PaidLeave legislation would empower women, strengthen families, support businesses, and grow the U.S. economy. I am proud to be a cosponsor, and I look forward to working with my colleagues to get this bill signed into law.https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/paid-family-leave-democrats_us_5c61bbfce4b0eec79b26b140 …
text: Family #PaidLeave legislation would empower women, strengthen families, support businesses, and grow the U.S. economy. I am proud to be a cosponsor, and I look forward to working with my colleagues to get this bill signed into law.https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/paid-family-leave-democrats_us_5c61bbfce4b0eec79b26b140 …

html: Can you imagine being forced to choose between putting food on the table or taking care of a sick loved one? No one should have to think about it, let alone experience it. That is why I am a cosponsor of the #FAMILYAct. It is time for a national #PaidLeave policy that works.
text: Can you imagine being forced to choose between putting food on the table or taking care of a sick loved one? No one should have to think about it, let alone experience it. That is why I am a cosponsor of the #FAMILYAct. It is time for a national #PaidLeave policy that works.

html: LGBTQ+ people often have to face down additional hurdles to access paid family leave. Passing the #FAMILYAct would ensure they don't risk their economic livelihood to care for a loved one. Thank you, @HRC, for being an ally in the fight for #PaidLeave!
text:
LGBTQ+ people often have to face down additional hurdles to access paid family leave. Passing the #FAMILYAct would ensure they don't risk their economic livelihood to care for a loved one. 

Thank you, @HRC, for being an ally in the fight for #PaidLeave!

html: Thank you for your support of #paidleave for all!
text: Thank you for your support of #paidleave for all!

The #FAMILYAct would guarantee #PaidLeave for moms and dads (and many others!). A national paid leave policy is urgently needed to shift care-giving norms and to make workplaces more equitable and family friendly. I am proud to cosponsor this legislation.pic.twitter.com/zSowVxz403
text: The #FAMILYAct would guarantee #PaidLeave for moms and dads (and many others!). A national paid leave policy is urgently needed to shift care-giving norms and to make workplaces more equitable and family friendly. I am proud to cosponsor this legislation.pic.twitter.com/zSowVxz403

html: You've heard the statistic: women working full time, year-round typically are paid just 80 cents for every dollar paid to their male counterparts, and this gap is even wider for women of color. We can't accept that. We must #RaiseTheWage. 3/3
text:
You've heard the statistic: women working full time, year-round typically are paid just 80 cents for every dollar paid to their male counterparts, and this gap is even wider for women of color.

We can't accept that. We must #RaiseTheWage. 3/3

html: Women make up nearly two-thirds of workers paid the federal minimum wage of $7.25 per hour. Women are also make up two-thirds of tipped workers, for whom the federal minimum cash wage is just $2.13 per hour. 2/3
text: Women make up nearly two-thirds of workers paid the federal minimum wage of $7.25 per hour. Women are also make up two-thirds of tipped workers, for whom the federal minimum cash wage is just $2.13 per hour. 2/3

html: THREAD: The federal minimum wage has been stuck at $7.25 an hour for ten years. In that time, inflation has eaten away at its purchasing power by as much as 15%. As an American, and as a woman, this issue matters a lot to me. It is time to #RaiseTheWage 1/pic.twitter.com/U4crjrAfza
text:
THREAD: The federal minimum wage has been stuck at $7.25 an hour for ten years. In that time, inflation has eaten away at its purchasing power by as much as 15%.

html: This shutdown is now the longest government shutdown in US history. President Trump has repeatedly refused to accept a bipartisan deal to reopen the government, and Senate Majority Leader McConnell refuses to bring legislation to the floor, which would easily pass the Senate.
text: This shutdown is now the longest government shutdown in US history. President Trump has repeatedly refused to accept a bipartisan deal to reopen the government, and Senate Majority Leader McConnell refuses to bring legislation to the floor, which would easily pass the Senate.

html: It's time for the President and Senate Republicans to reopen the government. People's lives are not bargaining chips. We should be able to debate policy without closing the government. #ShutdownStories
text: It's time for the President and Senate Republicans to reopen the government. People's lives are not bargaining chips. We should be able to debate policy without closing the government. #ShutdownStories

html: Air traffic controllers have incredibly stressful jobs keeping us safe – but federal ATCs aren’t getting paid during the shutdown. The House already voted to fund the FAA this week. It’s time for the Senate to do the same. #EndTheShutdownhttps://goo.gl/f5km61

html: On my way into the Capitol, I was approached by a fed employee who has a newborn who needs surgery. Bc of #TrumpsShutdown, the parents can't reach @OMBPress to add their baby to their health insurance. No insurance, no surgery. Now on Trump's hostage list: our youngest Americans.
